title: Bargain Booze owner shares jump on £200m Matthew Clark takeover
text:

Tue, Sep 8, 2015, 10:42 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 48 mins Bargain Booze owner shares jump on £200m Matthew Clark takeover By Ashley Armstrong | Telegraph – 3 minutes 50 seconds ago 188.0001 +33.0001 
Conviviality Retail (LSE: CVR.L - news ) has secured a takeover of Punch Taverns (Other OTC: PCTVY - news ) ' drinks distribution arm 
Shares (Berlin: DI6.BE - news ) in Conviviality Retail, the owner of off-licences Bargain Booze and Wine Rack, have soared on the back of a £200m takeover of the UK’s biggest drinks distributor. 
Conviviality Retail shares were suspended at the start of July after the Aim-listed company revealed that it was in takeover talks with drinks wholesaler Matthew Clark. 
Matthew Clark was put up for sale earlier this year by its shareholders Punch Taverns, Britain’s second largest pub group , and Accolade Wines, owned by Australian private equity firm CHAMP. 
Punch Taverns is selling its stake for £100.7m in cash and will receive a £1.5m dividend from Matthew Clark prior to closing the deal. Accolade Wines is also selling its 50pc stake to Conviviality and both shareholders have entered into a 10-year non-exclusive supply contract. 
The deal, which is classed as a reverse takeover due to Conviviality Retail’s smaller market value, is being funded by a £130m share placing and a £80m drawdown of the group’s debt facilities. 
The placing, which is being handled by Investec (LSE: INVP.L - news ) and Zeus Capital, has a price of 150p a share, a 3.2pc discount to Conviviality’s closing price on July 8 before shares were suspended. 
“We are pleased to have reached agreement on the acquisition of Matthew Clark as this will accelerate our strategy of expanding our wholesaling expertise into new markets and channels,” said Diana Hunter, chief executive of Conviviality. 
“Matthew Clark has a leading position in the independent on-trade market, complementing Conviviality's position in the off-trade, and the team bring significant on-trade wholesaling expertise and an unrivalled portfolio of high quality and loyal customers.” 
Conviviality shares were trading up 37.7p, or 24.4pc to 192.75p, while Punch Tavern shares were up 3.88p, or 3.18pc, to 125.8p.
